headline.main: STUDY DETAILS RISK TO WOMEN SMOKERS

byline.original: By WARREN E. LEARY, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Women who smoke as few as one to four cigarettes a day increase their risk of heart attack two to three times, according to a major study released today.
docs.snippet: LEAD: Women who smoke as few as one to four cigarettes a day increase their risk of heart attack two to three times, according to a major study released today.
